oai_dc:dc.dc:title: James Robertson historic marker, Nashville, Tennessee, 1978 May
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An historic marker in tribute to James Robertson that reads: “James Robertson, 1742-1814: ‘The Father of Middle Tennessee:’ leader of the first settlers who came to the Cumberland from East Tennessee and established the settlement which grew into the present city of Nashville: Brigadier General of the District: Chairman of the Committee of Notables: and in 1796 a member of the convention that framed the first Constitution of the State of Tennessee.’” Robertson died near Memphis and was buried there but reinterred in 1825 in the Nashville City Cemetery. Forms part of the Claynita Harris Slide Collection. The original is a 35 mm color transparency (2 x 2 in. slide mount)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Robertson, James, 1742-1814
